fields.name: Baron Edmond de Rothschild Montagne-Saint-Émilion 2018
fields.bio: This delicious Saint-Émilion look-a-like is made by Domaine Baron de Rothschild – the same family behind First Growth £1,000-a-bottle Château Lafite. They bring all the same expertise to this. It’s from Montagne-Saint-Émilion – one of the only Saint-Émilion satellite appellations with high enough quality wines to use the Saint-Émilion name. Thanks to its Lafite-standard winemakers, it punches well above its price point. It’s rich. It’s savoury. It’s full of both fresh and dried fruit flavours.
fields.pairings: Steaks, Charcuterie Boards, Cheeses

fields.name: Bread and Butter Cabernet Sauvignon 2019, California
fields.bio: California is where you’ll find some of the world’s most coveted Cabernet Sauvignon. This is made in the image of the very best of the Golden State. It’s aged in both French and American oak to deepen its complexity and soften its texture for an enviably smooth sip. Expect lavish notes of vanilla and sweet spice, blackberry, cherries and chocolate. Fantastic with steak with blue cheese.
fields.pairings: Steaks, Blue Cheese

fields.name: Réserve des Diacres Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2018
fields.bio: To buy a single row of vines in Châteauneuf-du-Pape, you’ll pretty much need to re-mortgage your house. It’s no wonder the wines are so expensive – until now. We worked with Baptiste Grangeon, owner and winemaker of renowned Domaine Cristia, to blend the perfect Châteauneuf – without the typical price tag. It’s blended from three different terroirs within the region: sand, limestone and the famous ‘galets roulés’ pebbles. The magic? Blending from these different terroirs is the secret to the best Châteauneuf. Dense. Rich. Heady. It’s full of spice and raspberry and redcurrant fruit. And its firm structure makes it perfect with Mediterranean-style foods, like rustic vegetable dishes.
fields.pairings: Mediterranean Cuisine, Rustic Vegetable Dishes

fields.name: Catena Zapata 'Catena Alta' Malbec 2017/18, Mendoza
fields.bio: Catena Zapata was awarded 'World's Most Admired Wine Brand 2020' by Drinks International Magazine. They're experts in Mendoza Malbec and are largely responsible for putting Argentinian fine wine on the world map. It really shows in this rich, supple red. It has notes of black fruit, violets, mocha and vanilla that are a treat with a sirloin steak.
fields.pairings: Rich red meat dishes

fields.name: Von Der Land Zweigelt 2019/20
fields.bio: This Austrian wine is a project between the prestigious Bauer family and one of the country's leading wine experts, Ferdinand Mayr. Von der Land is a celebration of the expressive quality of the Austrian land. Discover notes of cherries and a touch of oak. Enjoy with roast duck.
fields.pairings: Roast Dinners: Poultry, Meat, Nut Roasts

fields.name: Chronic Cellars 'Purple Paradise' 2019, Paso Robles
fields.bio: Jake and Josh Beckett grew up in Paso Robles wine country. So it was no coincidence that the pair would found Chronic Cellars together back in 2004. ‘Chronic’ is the brothers’ shorthand for ‘awesome’, as, with thanks to their close contacts with the best grape growers, these wines are made from the finest grapes. It certainly shows in this Zinfandel-based blend which really does taste ‘purple’. Rich. Ripe. Bold. It’s full of plum, black fruit, lush vanilla and chocolate spice. Soft and approachable – it's the perfect wine to share with friends over barbecue pulled pork.
fields.pairings: BBQ: Pulled Pork, Skewer Kebabs

fields.name: Cuvée Pierre Brun 2018/19 Domaine des Tourelles
fields.bio: When it comes to Lebanese wines it's not only Château Musar that's worth collecting. Founded in 1868, Tourelles is Lebanon's oldest winery. It's now run by Faouzi Issa, who earned his stripes working in Côte Rôtie and at iconic Château Margaux.This experience is reaping rewards. A blend of Cabernet, Syrah, Cinsault and Carignan, this has fine aromatic morello cherry and spice aromas, a dark fruit core with layered earthy spice, and balanced tannins.
fields.pairings: Perfect with anything from Vegan to Meat dishes, a true all-rounder!

fields.name: The Guv'nor
fields.bio: The Guv'nor is delicious proof that throwing out the rulebook can yield fantastic results. Spain’s wine laws are notoriously strict and convoluted. The Guv'nor breaks them all. We commissioned the winemakers to make the best wine they could – no rules, no restrictions, no red tape. The bottle they want to kick back with after a long day in the vineyards. The result? It’s bold. It’s fruity. It’s a very modern Spanish red that goes with anything, especially spicy barbecue meats or anything chargrilled.
fields.pairings: Spicy barbecued meats, chargrilled meats

fields.name: Barolo 2017 Ciabot Berton
fields.bio: If you're seeking a wine as fine as your celebrations, you can't beat the iconic power, richness and sophistication of Italy's star wine, Barolo. Kerin O'Keefe, of the wine enthusiast has awarded this Barolo a huge 93 point score and said, 'This boasts alluring scents of new leather, rose petal and pipe tobacco. The juicy palate delivers raspberry compote, red cherry, licorice and white pepper alongside firm, polished tannins.
fields.pairings: Rich pasta, meats

fields.name: Definition Pinot Noir 2019, Marlborough
fields.bio: Kiwi Pinot Noir is a real success story. It’s no longer simply compared to Burgundy – it’s become a coveted style of Pinot in its own right. So, it was a no-brainer addition to our Definition range. We wanted something exciting to do justice to New Zealand’s pioneering spirit. So, we headed to Marlborough. The region’s history with Pinot is younger, but if there was anyone who could help us get the blend just right it was Marlborough and Pinot experts, Saint Clair. With them we selected grapes from top parcels in the Southern Valleys – the best site for Pinot in the region. The results speak for themselves. It’s deliciously savoury with classic Marlborough dark fruit. Think black cherry and raspberry. It’s perfumed but fresh, with fine tannins and a lovely silky texture. Ideal with duck.
fields.pairings: Perfect with Duck and general Poultry dishes

fields.name: Domaine Jean-Max Roger ‘Cuvée Genese’ Sancerre 2019/20
fields.bio: Jean-Max Roger began with just four hectares of vines. In the 50 years since, he's consistently produced sensational Sauvignon Blanc, and his winery is now one of Sancerre's finest. Today, he and his two sons pick each grape by hand on sustainably-run vineyards. This wine is then only released when the Rogers deem it ready. And the attention to detail shines in every sip. This is a remarkably fresh and complex Sancerre. Pair its notes of citrus and white flowers and long, flavoursome finish with white fish.
fields.pairings: White Fish: Dover Sole, Cod, Haddock

fields.name: La Raia 'Il Borgo' Gavi 2020
fields.bio: This organic Gavi is from a bucolic paradise which shows why biodynamic farming and winemaking is such a great thing. The vineyards nestle between orchards of chestnuts, elderflower and acacia. Wildlife buzzes between the vines. The Cario family settled here nearly two decades ago – two decades which have seen immense change in the landscape as they’ve returned to biodynamic farming. This wine is an homage to that landscape. It has a real purity and freshness to it which immediately transports you to Piedmont. We love the blend of zingy flavour with stone-fruity, almond and blossom aromas. It’s a really pretty wine. The incredible crispness means it works perfectly with anything Mediterranean and tomato-based.
fields.pairings: Mediterranean Cuisine, Tomato-Based Dishes

fields.name: Rocklin Ranch Chardonnay 2018/19, Monterey
fields.bio: Rocklin Ranch has sustainability at its heart. Situated in the volcanic foothills of Monterey, their winery is powered by a single wind turbine. They take their name from the ancient river rocks deposited around their vineyards. Monterey’s reputation for distinctive white wines is certainly reflected in this first-class bottle. Classic Chardonnay lovers, this one’s for you. Bright and elegant, this has notes of red apple, pear and lemon. Pair with a grilled chicken caesar salad.
fields.pairings: Salads

fields.name: Domaine L. Chatelain Chablis 2020
fields.bio: A sip of this Chablis is like taking a bite of a Granny Smith apple. It’s intensely refreshing – so crisp and citrussy that you can’t help going back for a second glass. Domaine Chatelain are known for this classic style for good reason. We love it with oysters.
fields.pairings: Seafood: Oysters especially

fields.name: Pinot Gris Grand Cru Spiegel 2018/19 Domaines Schlumberger
fields.bio: Spiegel is known as one of the best sites in Alsace for Pinot Gris, and lies on an east-facing slope of sandy clay. Winemaking is subject to Schlumberger's legendary attention to detail, including hand-selection of the grapes, whole-bunch pressing and careful lees ageing. A wine of great texture and depth of flavour, this Pinot Gris is at once youthfully vibrant, harmonious and mature. The palate is full of ripe white fruit, with finely balanced sweetness and acidity. Drink with ripe soft cheeses or rich, creamy duck liver pâte.
fields.pairings: Ripe soft cheeses, rich duck liver pâte

fields.name: Peter and Ulrich Dry Riesling 2020
fields.bio: From the small family winery Peter & Ulrich Griebeler in the Mosel. This wine is crisp and elegant with notes of ripe apple, peach and apricot. A perfect balance between rich fruit flavours and refreshing acidity with just a hint of minerality on the finish.
fields.pairings: A great food wine this will match with salads, fish or lightly spiced meat dishes.

fields.name: Saint Clair Pioneer Block Chardonnay 2019 Marlborough
fields.bio: St. Clair have gone for maximum impact and expression with this Chardonnay, fermenting 100% of the grapes in a mixture of new and old French oak, before ageing the wine on for 9 months, with regular stirring to draw full character from the lees. The New Zealand trademarks of fresh and snappy peach and tropical fruits are finished with a wonderfully soft, generous texture and a biscuity edge. Rich, with plentiful amounts of pure, tropical fruit.
fields.pairings: This wine is fantastic with grilled asparagus or fish with parsley sauce.

fields.name: Cline 'Nancy's Vines' Viognier 2019/20
fields.bio: Fred Cline is one of the original 'Rhône Rangers', who broke tradition by working with traditionally French grape varieties on the West Coast of America. Along with wife Nancy, he creates this rich, golden style of Viognier. It is full-bodied with crisp acidity, notes of tropical fruit, apricot and orange.
fields.pairings: A perfect match for Thai cuisine.

fields.name: Nautilus Chardonnay 2019, Marlborough
fields.bio: At Nautilus, everything is done with sustainability in mind. The winery is part of the Sustainable Winegrowers New Zealand programme and has been owned by the same dedicated family for 25 years. In this Chardonnay, expect classic notes of nectarine and almond, with a creamy finish to come as it matures.
fields.pairings: Match this luxurious white with an equally creamy pasta.

fields.name: Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc 2020, Marlborough
fields.bio: Cloudy Bay's huge success is largely down to groundbreaking Sauvignon Blanc. This is one of New Zealand's most celebrated wines and a real benchmark for quality. And remarkably, it will develop with age over the next five years. You can say the same for very few Sauvignon Blancs. Expect a complex and layered Sauvignon, with notes of ripe lemon, lime, passionfruit, peach and freshly cut grass.
fields.pairings: Serve this chilled with beautifully seared salmon
